task_summary: Perceive the T-shaped block and goal outline, approach and align to the block, set yaw, then execute repeated short pushes toward the goal and finally retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-type arm with a circular end-effector pushes a T-shaped block across a white tabletop toward a drawn goal outline. The robot first locates both the block and the goal, approaches to a safe height, and aligns its tool to the block’s face. It then performs a series of short, controlled pushes roughly toward the goal, re-aligning between pushes to keep contact stable. After displacement appears sufficient, the robot backs away and pauses. Frequencies are 10 Hz for observation and control; pushes are conservative in distance and time.
preconditions: Block and goal outline present on table
Robot reachable workspace covers object and target
stepwise_plan: Detect the T block and the goal outline; scan if not visible.
Move above the block and align to a pushing face.
Set tool yaw to a diagonal (≈135°) toward the goal.
Repeat: push a short distance, then re-align to maintain heading.
Retreat from the object and briefly wait.
success_criteria: Block translated toward/into the goal outline
No loss of contact causing undesired rotations
Robot ends safely away from the block
failure_and_recovery: Block or goal not detected → raster scan and retry detection
Misalignment or slip during push → re-align and attempt next push
task_long_description.termination: After completing the planned push cycles and retreat, or if visibility cannot be recovered after scans.

frame_3.now_evidence: First firm contact and alignment before push are clearly visible.
frame_3.predicts_next: Push actuation should follow; indicates intended direction.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Checks if the T block is visible.
Raster scan to find the block if not visible.
Checks if the goal outline is visible.
Raster scan to find the goal outline.
Move above the block to a safe height.
Approach the block and align to a pushing face.
Orient tool to push along the diagonal toward the goal.
Execute a short push toward the goal.
Re-align after a push to correct drift.

failure_modes: Perception fails to detect block or goal
Incorrect yaw leading to off-target push
recovery_strategy: Use ScanForTarget when visibility is lost
Bounded repetition of push cycles via Repeat
assumptions: Frames show a red T block rather than gray; we prioritize frames over text.
Goal is a blue outline on the table; success inferred visually.
Push direction approximated as 135° (upper-left) based on frame motion.

expected_success_criteria: Block’s centroid moves toward/into the blue outline
Robot retreats safely at the end
No overturning or excessive rotation of the block
